org.openimaj.image.analysis.algorithm.histogram

Interface WindowedHistogramExtractor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinnedWindowedExtractor, GradientOrientationHistogramExtractor, InterpolatedBinnedWindowedExtractor, SATWindowedExtractor

    public interface WindowedHistogramExtractor
    The primary purpose of this interface is to produce efficient access to (rectangular) histograms of arbitrary windows of an image. A number of methods are provided to extract such histograms.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Histogram computeHistogram(int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Compute the histogram for the given window.
      void computeHistogram(int x, int y, int w, int h, Histogram histogram)
      Compute the histogram for the given window, storing the output in the given Histogram object, which must have the same length as given by getNumBins().
      Histogram computeHistogram(org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle roi)
      Compute the histogram for the given window.
      void computeHistogram(org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle roi, Histogram histogram)

      Get the number of bins

      • getNumBins

        int getNumBins()
        Get the number of bins
        Returns:
        the number of bins

      • computeHistogram

        Histogram computeHistogram(org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle roi)
        Compute the histogram for the given window.
        Parameters:
        roi - the window
        Returns:
        the histogram in the window of the last analysed image

      • computeHistogram

        Histogram computeHistogram(int x,
                         int y,
                         int w,
                         int h)
        Compute the histogram for the given window.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left of the window
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left of the window
        w - The width of the window
        h - The height of the window
        Returns:
        the histogram in the window of the last analysed image

      • computeHistogram

        void computeHistogram(org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle roi,
                    Histogram histogram)
        Compute the histogram for the given window, storing the output in the given Histogram object, which must have the same length as given by getNumBins().
        Parameters:
        roi - the window
        histogram - the histogram to write to

      • computeHistogram

        void computeHistogram(int x,
                    int y,
                    int w,
                    int h,
                    Histogram histogram)
        Compute the histogram for the given window, storing the output in the given Histogram object, which must have the same length as given by getNumBins().
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left of the window
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left of the window
        w - The width of the window
        h - The height of the window
        histogram - the histogram to write to
